intro: Muehlenbeckia tamnifolia var. hartwegii, commonly known as the silver hair plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its silver-white, woolly leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
